noun.description: The lowest point or part of something.
examples: she paused at the bottom of the stairs
he climbs the side of the gorge, scratching his bottom unselfconsciously

noun.description: One of six flavors of quark.
Stamina or strength of character, especially of a horse.
A man who takes the passive role in anal intercourse with another man.
The second half of an inning.

examples: the books on the bottom shelf

verb.description: (of a performance or situation) reach the lowest point before stabilizing or improving.

phrases: But one thing that has disturbed me has been the number of people who, at bottom, don't seem to really believe in grace or mercy.
At bottom, Greenberg's theology rests on the conviction that the Holocaust was a revelatory event.
We rest, at bottom, on the inherent dignity of the individual.
Once the novel language is stripped away, it is apparent that most of these supposed new challenges are, at bottom, techniques.
origin: Old English botm, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch bodem bottom, ground and German Boden ground, earth.
